Add another tier prompt: Want to add members with different voting power? Add another tier.
Advanced configuration warning: This is an advanced feature. Threshold and quorum can interact in counterintuitive ways. If you configure them without fully understanding how they work, you can lock your DAO, making it impossible for proposals to pass.
Beta warning: DAO DAO is in beta, and has not yet been audited. Do not keep large sums of money in your DAO, and do not use your DAO for anything mission critical.
Configure voting description: Add members, configure voting thresholds, and (optionally) use governance tokens to determine voting share.
Configure wallet to continue (long):
You have Keplr installed, but it doesn't seem like you've set up a wallet. To continue, open the Keplr extension and set up a wallet.
To open the Keplr extension press the puzzle icon in the top right of your browser and then press the Keplr button. Once you've done that, a new page will open where you'll be able to create a new account. Configure your wallet to continue
Create first proposal prompt: This DAO has no proposals. Why not create one?
Governance Token-based description: Fluid organization with many members who leave and join frequently. Members can join and leave by exchanging governance shares.
Image URL tooltip: A link an image. For example: https://moonphase.is/image.svg
Membership-based description: Small organization with a few members who are likely to stick around. Members can be added and removed by a vote of existing members.
Name: Name
Need wallet to continue: You'll need a wallet to continue
Need wallet to continue (long):
Your wallet is your digital identity on the blockchain. Having one lets you interact with web3 applications like DAO DAO.
We recommend the Keplr wallet
Passing threshold description: The percentage of votes that must be 'yes' in order for a proposal to pass. For example, with a 50% passing threshold, half of the voting power must be in favor of a proposal to pass it.
Prompt to create a DAO: You're not a member of any DAOs. Why not create one?
Proposal deposit description: The number of governance tokens that must be deposited in order to create a proposal. Setting this high may deter spam, but setting it too high may limit broad participation.
Proposal deposit refund description: Should a failed proposal have its deposit refunded to the proposer? (Proposals that pass will always have their deposit returned). Turning this on, particularly when proposal deposits are high, may encourage members to deliberate with other members before creating a proposal.
Quorum description: The minumum percentage of voting power that must vote on a proposal for it to be considered. For example, in the US House of Representatives, 218 members must be present for a vote. If you have an org with many inactive members, setting this value too high may make it difficult to pass proposals.
Stake all but proposal deposit: Stake all but the {{proposalDeposit}} ${{tokenSymbol}} proposal deposit
Terms of service: DAO DAO TOOLING IS PROVIDED "AS IS", AT YOUR OWN RISK, AND WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND. No developer or entity involved in creating the DAO DAO UI or smart contracts will be liable for any claims or damages whatsoever associated with your use, inability to use, or your interaction with other users of DAO DAO tooling, including any direct, indirect, incidental, special, exemplary, punitive or consequential damages, or loss of profits, cryptocurrencies, tokens, or anything else of value.
Tier description: The "class" of member. For example: "Core developers" or "friends and family." These names are only for your reference.
Treasury balance description: {{numberOfTokensMinted, number}} tokens will be minted. {{memberPercent, number(minimumFractionDigits:2)}}% will be sent to members according to the distribution above. The reamining {{treasuryPercent, number(minimumFractionDigits:2)}}% will go to the DAO's treasury, where they can be distributed later via governance proposal.
Unstaking mechanics: If you unstake now, it will take {{humanReadableTime}} until they are available to you. During that time, you will not recieve staking rewards. You will not be able to cancel the unbonding.
Unstaking period description: In order to vote, members must stake their tokens with the DAO. Members who would like to leave the DAO or trade their governance tokens must first unstake them. This setting configures how long members have to wait after unstaking their tokens for those tokens to become available. The longer you set this duration, the more sure you can be that people who register their tokens are keen to participate in your DAO's governance.
Voting duration description: The amount of time that a proposal will remain open for voting. After this time elapses, the proposal will either pass or fail.
You are about to unstake: You are about to unstake governance tokens
You must have voting power to create a p: You must have voting power to create a proposal. Stake tokens to get voting power.
allAbstainClarification: When all abstain, a proposal will fail
checkInternetOrTryAgain: Check your internet connection or try again later.
claimToReceiveUnstaked: Claim them to receive your unstaked tokens.
connectWalletToViewUnstaking: Connect your wallet to view unstaking tokens.
connectWalletToViewVote: Connect your wallet to view your vote.
couldHaveMoreVotingPower: You could have more voting power.
couldntFindDAO: We couldn't find a DAO with that address. Search DAOs on the <2>home page</2>.
couldntFindProposal: We couldn't find a proposal with that ID. See all proposals on the <2>DAO's home page</2>.
daoPaused: The DAO is paused. Governance will resume in {{duration}}.
didNotCastVote: You didn't cast a vote when this proposal was open.
didNotVote: You did not vote on this proposal.

error.cannotStakeMoreThanYouHave: You can't stake or unstake more tokens than you have.
error.cannotTxZeroTokens: You can't stake, unstake, or claim zero tokens.
error.createProposalSubmitValidationError: Correct the errors above before previewing or publishing.
error.daoIsPaused: You cannot create a proposal when the DAO is paused.
error.mustBeMemberToCreateProposal: You must be a member of the DAO to create a proposal
error.noGovTokenAddr: You didn't provide an address for your governance token.
error.noGovTokenInfo: You didn't give enough information about your governance token.
error.noMembers: You haven't added any members to your DAO
error.noProposalModule: This DAO does not have a proposal module.
error.noVotingPower: You have not given anyone voting power. Add some members to your DAO.
error.notEnoughForDeposit: You do not have enough tokens in your balance to pay the proposal deposit

haveNotCastVote: You have not yet cast a vote.
internalServerError: An internal server error occured on this page.
mustHaveVotingPowerAtCreation: You must have voting power at the time of proposal creation to vote.
mustHaveVotingPowerAtCreationTooltip_clo: You were unable to vote on this proposal because you didn't have any voting power at the time of proposal creation.
mustHaveVotingPowerAtCreationTooltip_ope: You are unable to vote on this proposal because you didn't have any voting power at the time of proposal creation.
noTokensUnstaking: You are not waiting for any tokens to unstake.
notAMemberYet: You are not a member yet.
preReleaseExplanation: This is a pre-release version of DAO DAO running on the {{chain}} chain.
proposalQuorumExplanation: This proportion of voting power must vote on a proposal for it to pass.
proposalThresholdExplanation: A proposal must attain this proportion of 'Yes' votes to pass.
stakeToIncreaseVotingPower: Stake these to increase your voting power.
stakeToJoinAndVote: Stake these to join and vote.
stakeTokensSuggestion: Stake some tokens so you can vote next time?
walletConnectMobileLimitations: Please feel free to explore the UI. Due to current limitations in WalletConnect, you will not be able to connect your mobile wallet to the {{chain}} chain.
